item.title: ChatGPT is down worldwide with something went wrong error
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: ChatGPT, the famous artificial intelligence chatbot that allows users to converse with various personalities and topics, has connectivity issues worldwide. [...]

item.title: Police shuts down KidFlix child sexual exploitation platform
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Kidflix, one of the largest platforms used to host, share, and stream child sexual abuse material (CSAM) on the dark web, was shut down on March 11 following a joint action coordinated by German law enforcement. [...]

item.title: The Reality Behind Security Control Failures—And How to Prevent Them
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by OnDefend
item.description: Most orgs only discover their security controls failed after a breach. With OnDefend's continuous validation, you can test, measure, and prove your defenses work—before attackers exploit blind spots. [...]

item.title: Counterfeit Android devices found preloaded with Triada malware
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A new version of the Triada trojan has been discovered preinstalled on thousands of new Android devices, allowing threat actors to steal data as soon as they are set up. [...]

item.title: Cisco warns of CSLU backdoor admin account used in attacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Cisco warns admins to patch a critical Cisco Smart Licensing Utility (CSLU) vulnerability, which exposes a built-in backdoor admin account now used in attacks. [...]

item.title: New Windows 11 trick lets you bypass Microsoft Account requirement
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: A previously unknown trick lets you easily bypass using a Microsoft Account in Windows 11, just as Microsoft tries to make it harder to use local accounts. [...]

item.title: North Korean IT worker army expands operations in Europe
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​North Korea's IT workers have expanded operations beyond the United States and are now increasingly targeting organizations across Europe. [...]

item.title: We Smell a (DC)Rat: Revealing a Sophisticated Malware Delivery Chain
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Acronis
item.description: A RAR file, a fake summons, and a Nietzsche quote—all part of a multi-stage malware chain delivering DCRat & Rhadamanthys. Acronis TRU breaks down how attackers use VBS, batch, and PowerShell scripts to slip past defenses. [...]

item.title: Apple fined €150 million over App Tracking Transparency issues
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Autorité de la concurrence, France's antitrust watchdog, has fined Apple €150 million ($162 million) for using the App Tracking Transparency privacy framework to abuse its dominant market position in mobile app advertising on its devices. [...]

item.title: Google rolls out easy end-to-end encryption for Gmail business users
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Google has started rolling out a new end-to-end encryption (E2EE) model for Gmail enterprise users, making it easier to send encrypted emails to any recipient. [...]

item.title: Nearly 24,000 IPs behind wave of Palo Alto Global Protect scans
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A significant spike in scanning activity targeting Palo Alto Network GlobalProtect login portals has been observed, with researchers concerned it may be a prelude to an upcoming attack or flaw being exploited. [...]

item.title: Apple backports zero-day patches to older iPhones and Macs
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Apple has released security updates that backport fixes for actively exploited vulnerabilities that were exploited as zero-days to older versions of its operating systems. [...]

item.title: Critical auth bypass bug in CrushFTP now exploited in attacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Attackers are now targeting a critical authentication bypass vulnerability in the CrushFTP file transfer software using exploits based on publicly available proof-of-concept code. [...]
